result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobby A. Pulliam was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $200 Cash Bond previously posted has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs are to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: No Good Time credit.  No Huber Privileges due to employment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges granted.  Balance of sentence to be served forthwith.
Court Costs as to both Counts in the amount of $886.00 are paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for Count No. 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bobby A. Pulliam

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 8:40 AM: Defendant Bobby A. Pulliam in court with attorney John H. Wallace.  Defendant Bobby A. Pulliam in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Parties admit receipt of Rev Order and Warrant.  No factual corrections offered.  Argument by ADA Anderson.  Counsel stipulate to 62 days of TS credit.  Chapter 950 in compliance.  Argues for 150 days as to Ct 1 and 30 days as to Ct 2 consecutive to Ct 1.  Argument by Atty Wallace.  Argues for 85 days WCJ as to Ct 1 and 30 days as to Ct 2 with concurrent terms.  Would more than likely result in time served sentence.  Statement by Def:  Yes.  The Court:  Imposes as to Ct 1:  135 days WCJ with 62 TS credit. Ct 2:  30 WCJ concurrent to Ct 1.  GT and Huber, any release for child chare would be subject to the jail rules of the Huber program. Approx 40 more days to serve.  Any unfulfilled financial obligations to be paid w/in 60 days or PP.  Appeal Rights GIven.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 2, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Inmate Request to the Court, Dated 7/25/2016

Case Called @ 1:38 PM: Defendant Bobby A. Pulliam in court, appearing in person pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions Def as to status of counsel.  Per Def:  Cash issues exists.  Just commenced employment on 1/4/16.  Per ADA:  Did meet with Def a few weeks back and offer was extended.  Def was unsure if he still wanted counsel.  Defendant states he wishes to speak further with the ADA on his own w/o counsel.  Off Record for parties to meet.  Back of Record @ 1:47 PM:  Per ADA:  In general agreement has been reached w/argued terms on sentencing recommendation.  Defendant has a concern over ability to exercise Huber for child care purposes.  Defendant states he is also employed.  Court advises Defendant that he will not be able to utilize Huber for both.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Amended Complaint stated - Receipt Admitted and Reading Waived.  Court accepts State's motion to amend as to Ct 1 to Misd level POT Plea:  NC  Ct 2 (POP) Plea:  NC   Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.   Argument by ADA.  Argument by Def - argues for lesser supervision and WCJ time - apologizes to the Court.  The Court:  S/W - 18 mos probation. Conditions:  4 days WCJ as to Ct 1 cond'l - No GT, No Huber due to employment in Madison, No TS credit, Report:  3/25/2016 at 8:00 PM;  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; AODA and any follow thru as deemed appropriate; Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.

Pre-trial conference at 01-13-2016 03:45 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance at 01-29-2016 01:45 pm.

Case Called @ 1:15 PM: Defendant Bobby A. Pulliam in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Defendant's search for retainer continues and requests add'l time to obtain counsel.  Based upon earnings Court states that he would be found ineligible for SPD services and/or Court Appointed Counsel.  30 day extension given.  Court suggests that Def may wish to discuss matter with the DA prior to deciding on counsel issue.  Court accepts voluntary waiver of counsel.  Court finds good cause exists for adjournment of AIA today.  AIA Re-Scheduled - NOH Given.  Defendant reminded that bond will continue as previously ordered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 03:45 pm.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 2:11 PM: Defendant Bobby A. Pulliam in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Defendant advised of right to counsel.  Def would like counsel - intends to retain his own counsel.  Court will proceed with the expectation that defendant's own counsel will be retained.    AIA scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State with probable cause finding as support in the Complaint.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 29, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
